alert.note: Alert for Bell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 3:33PM EDT until August 06 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following county, Bell. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 332 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow-moving thunderstorms. Excessive runoff will cause minor flooding of small creeks and streams, roads, and roadside culverts. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pineville, Middlesboro, Ferndale, Clear Creek Springs, Meldrum, East Pineville, Wasioto, Wallsend, Ponza, Binghamtown, Straight Creek, Calvin, Ingram, Fourmile, Cary, Noetown, Hutch, Varilla, Arjay and Davisburg.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
